body_html:
To build tensorflow on Raspberry Pi, there's a guide for it by @samjabrahams
https://github.com/samjabrahams/tensorflow-on-raspberry-pi/blob/master/GUIDE.md

There are links to compiled whls for tensorflow on his guide for python 2.7 and 3.4. I have also uploaded one for python 3.5 here
body_text:
To build tensorflow on Raspberry Pi, there's a guide for it by @samjabrahams
https://github.com/samjabrahams/tensorflow-on-raspberry-pi/blob/master/GUIDE.md
There are links to compiled whls for tensorflow on his guide for python 2.7 and 3.4. I have also uploaded one for python 3.5 here
body:
To build tensorflow on Raspberry Pi, there's a guide for it by @samjabrahams 
https://github.com/samjabrahams/tensorflow-on-raspberry-pi/blob/master/GUIDE.md

There are links to compiled whls for tensorflow on his guide for python 2.7 and 3.4. I have also uploaded one for python 3.5 [here](https://github.com/akashjobanputra/tensorflow-on-raspberry-pi/releases/tag/v1.2.1)
